duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide guidance and direction in the accurate completion of consumer work activities.
Plan and deliver daily service components in the areas of: Sensorimotor Development, Communicative Development, Social Development, Cognitive Development, and Vocational Readiness.
Assist consumers with personal hygiene and grooming.
Transport consumers to and from specified locations.
Supervise consumers in meeting appropriate production deadlines and maintain quality control.
Assist with time studies for establishing consumer piece rates and provide instruction as needed.
Maintain consumer work description sheets and observe and document consumer's progress on goal sheets daily.
Provide ongoing evaluation of consumer programs and recommend changes.
Assist coordinators with consumer's goals and objectives through personal observation and assessments.
Provide active treatment to consumers as it relates to IPP plan/Goals and Objectives.
Complete and submit transportation logs daily.
Report to Production Supervisor in regards to production matters.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or general education degree (GED) and a minimum of six months previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.
CPR/First Aid certification, TB Skin Test, and Arkansas Driver's License.
